Name: Band of tapestry
Description: This band of tapestry, which comes from the excavations of Akhmim, decorated a tunic or a hanging. The background is in unbleached linen and the tapestry is of crimson-brown wool and natural-coloured linen. The decoration, of dionysiac origin, shows three figures: a flute-player of Pan, a warrior and a dancer or menad. They are framed in niches surmounted by birds.
